item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, August 30, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Rearchiving 2M hours of digital radio, a comprehensive process (64 points | 9 comments)
2. The secret inside One Million Checkboxes (1526 points | 138 comments)
3. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (1674 points | 357 comments)
4. Low-cost 16 EEG channels cap (hat) for PiEEG (19 points | 3 comments)
5. Marketing to Engineers (118 points | 81 comments)
6. Time-Memory Trade-Offs Sound the Death Knell for GPRS and GSM (48 points | 19 comments)
7. Micrograd.jl (68 points | 7 comments)
8. Elasticsearch is open source, again (609 points | 307 comments)
9. Rubi: Symbolic integrator based on an extensive system of integration rules (17 points | 6 comments)
10. Pie doesn't need to be original (unless you claim it so) (24 points | 24 comments)
11. Scpptool – a tool to enforce a memory and data race safe subset of C++ (13 points | 3 comments)
12. End of the Road: An AnandTech Farewell (30 points | 4 comments)
13. SDL3 new GPU API merged (195 points | 76 comments)
14. Chrome is entrenching third-party cookies that will mislead users (405 points | 214 comments)
15. Thousands of papers misidentify microscopes, in possible sign of misconduct (8 points | 1 comment)
16. Visit Bletchley Park (113 points | 46 comments)

20. The Thin Purple Line (37 points | 24 comments)
21. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (311 points | 483 comments)
22. Google Closure Library has been archived (130 points | 50 comments)
23. Launch HN: CodeViz (YC S24) – Visual maps of your codebase in VS Code (153 points | 68 comments)
24. Firewall rules: not as secure as you think (126 points | 53 comments)
25. Predicting the future of distributed systems (47 points | 9 comments)
26. I'm blocking connections from AWS to my on-prem services (143 points | 86 comments)
27. Show HN: bpfquery – experimenting with compiling SQL to bpf(trace) (22 points | 5 comments)
28. Japan police: Nearly 4k who died alone at home not found for over a month (5 points | 1 comment)
29. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (212 points | 50 comments)
30. Anthropic's Prompt Engineering Interactive Tutorial (237 points | 58 comments)
